intro: Faramea cuspidata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are typically velvety and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its colorful blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Faramea cuspidata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
